009package imagingbook.common.geometry.shape;
010
011import java.awt.Shape;
012import java.awt.geom.FlatteningPathIterator;
013import java.awt.geom.PathIterator;
014import java.util.Iterator;
015
016import imagingbook.common.geometry.basic.Pnt2d;
017
018/**
019 * A small wrapper class to create a simple {@link Iterator} of
020 * {@link Pnt2d} to step over the individual points of
021 * a AWT {@link Shape} object. Curved shapes are flattened by a
022 * {@link FlatteningPathIterator}.
023 * 
024 * @author WB
025 * @see PathIterator
026 * @see FlatteningPathIterator
027 */
028public class ShapePointIterator implements Iterator<Pnt2d> {
029        
030        private final PathIterator pi;
031        private final double coords[] = new double[6];
032        
033        public ShapePointIterator(Shape shape, double flatness) {
034                this.pi = shape.getPathIterator(null, flatness);
035        }
036
037        @Override
038        public boolean hasNext() {
039                return !pi.isDone();
040        }
041
042        @Override
043        public Pnt2d next() {
044                if (pi.isDone()) {
045                        return null;
046                }
047                else {
048                        pi.currentSegment(coords);
049                        pi.next();
050                        return Pnt2d.from(coords[0], coords[1]);
051                }
052        }
053
054        
055//      public static void main(String[] args) {
056//              Pnt2d ctr = Pnt2d.from(20, 30);
057//              GeometricCircle gc = new GeometricCircle(20, 30, 100);
058//              Shape circle = gc.getShape();
059//              System.out.println("circle = " + circle);
060//              
061////            ShapePointIterator iter = new ShapePointIterator(circle, 0.01);
062////            while(iter.hasNext()) {
063////                    Pnt2d p = iter.next();
064////                    System.out.println(p + " dist = " + gc.getDistance(p));
065////            }
066//              
067//              System.out.println("checkShape = " + gc.checkShape(circle, 0.5));
068//              
069//      }
070}
